intro: Croton laevifolius, commonly known as the African croton, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves, which are typically green with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
